attributes.action: UK to give up its permanent seat on the UN Security Council
attributes.additional_details:
UK to give up its permanent seat on the UN Security Council if the UK Government can no longer afford or is unwilling to maintain defence spending at least 2% of UK GDP over the next 5 years, to allow another Nation who is prepared to maintain effective and deployable armed forces which can be used to support any future UN sanctioned action.

If UK defence falls below 2% of GDP it is likely our forces will become too small, disjointed and less effective.

.
